Badges badges badges!
Dec 02nd

We’ve been rolling out a bunch of new things lately and, thus, haven’t spent much time talking about our core foursquare badges. Time for some badge love: we roll out a ton of these, and they’re broken up into two groups. First, we have the surprise ones, which users unlock when they do certain things. While we don’t really talk about these, but you’ll probably see stories or tweets about them.
text: lately and, thus, haven’t spent much time talking about our core foursquare badges. Time for some badge love: we roll out a ton of these, and they’re broken up into two groups. First, we have the surprise ones, which users unlock when they do certain things. While we don’t really talk about these, but you’ll probably see

texts.html: The other type are badges we use to encourage and reward certain behaviors. Think the Gym Rat badge, which helps motivate and reward people for going to the gym. Here are a few of the many we’ve introduced recently:
text: The other type are badges we use to encourage and reward certain behaviors. Think the
badge, which helps motivate and reward people for going to the gym. Here are a few of the many we’ve introduced recently:

texts.html: Dog’s Best Friend – for frequenting dog parks
Great Outdoors – for getting out to parks to breathe in some fresh air
text: – for getting out to parks to breathe in some fresh air

texts.html: Swimmies – for the aquatic minded
9 to 5 – for those of us in the weekly grind
text: – for those of us in the weekly grind

texts.html: Hangover – we’re not encouraging hangovers, but are happy to salute people who keep on trucking!
text: – we’re not encouraging hangovers, but are happy to salute people who keep on trucking!

texts.html: Ski Bum – to commemorate your trips up the mountain
text: – to commemorate your trips up the mountain

texts.html: For those of you who love earning new badges, you can also see many of these ‘encouragement’ badges in your trophy case; if you hover over any locked badge (the ones that are grayed out), you’ll get hints to help you earn it.
text: For those of you who love earning new badges, you can also see many of these ‘encouragement’ badges in your
; if you hover over any locked badge (the ones that are grayed out), you’ll get hints to help you earn it.

texts.html: These are only a few of the many badges we’ve rolled out as we continue to match badges to activities that you love. Going forward, we’ll introduce many of these new badges on Twitter, so make sure you’re following @foursquare. Happy exploring!

Foursquare is a free app that helps you and your friends make the most of where you are. Share and save your experiences at the places you visit and get personalized recommendations for where to go.

Check here for the latest updates, tips, and Foursquare happenings!
